question: Which industry has more 'Quantitative' metrics to disclose in Table 1 between Metals & Mining and Electrical & Electronic Equipment industries?
optionE: It's not specified in the document
reference_text: | Greenhouse Gas Emissions | Gross global Scope 1 emissions, percentage covered under emissions-limiting regulations | Quantitative | Metric tons (t) CO2-e, Percentage (%) | EM-MM-110a.1 |
| Energy Management | (1) Total energy consumed, (2) percentage grid electricity, (3) percentage renewable | Quantitative | Gigajoules (GJ), Percentage (%) | EM-MM-130a.1 |

| Water Management | (1) Total fresh water withdrawn, (2) total fresh water consumed, percentage of each in regions with High or Extremely High Baseline Water Stress | Quantitative | Thousand cubic meters (m³), Percentage (%) | EM-MM-140a.1 |
| Water Management | Number of incidents of non-compliance associated with water quality permits, standards, and regulations | Quantitative | Number | EM-MM-140a.2 |
| Energy Management | (1) Total energy consumed, (2) percent- age grid electricity, (3) percentage renewable | Quantitative | Gigajoules (GJ), Percent- age (%) | RT-EE-130a.1 |
| | Percentage of products by revenue that contain IEC 62474 declarable substances | Quantitative | Percentage (%) by revenue | RT-EE-410a.1 |

| Product Lifecycle Management | Percentage of eligible products, by revenue, that meet ENERGY STAR® criteria certified to an energy efficiency certification | Quantitative | Percentage (%) by revenue | RT-EE-410a.2 |
| | Revenue from renewable energy-related and energy efficiency-related products | Quantitative | Reporting currency | RT-EE-410a.3 |

question: List the activity metrics for Metals & Mining and Electrical & Electronic Equipment industries.
optionA: Production of metal ores and finished metal products, Total number of employees
optionB: Number of units produced by product category, Number of employees
optionC: Production of metal ores and finished metal products, Number of units produced by product category
optionD: Total energy consumed, Total fresh water withdrawn
optionE: Percentage of products by revenue that contain IEC 62474 declarable substances, Number of incidents of non-compliance

| Number of employees | Quantitative | Number | RT-EE-000.B |

question: Are there any common sustainability topics between Metals & Mining and Electrical & Electronic Equipment industries? If so, how do their reporting requirements differ?
optionA: Both industries focus on Energy Management, but Metals & Mining includes Water Management, which Electrical & Electronic Equipment does not.
optionB: Both industries focus on Greenhouse Gas Emissions, but Metals & Mining includes Water Management, which Electrical & Electronic Equipment does not.
optionC: Both industries focus on Energy Management, but Metals & Mining includes Greenhouse Gas Emissions, which Electrical & Electronic Equipment does not.
optionD: Both industries focus on Water Management, but Metals & Mining includes Greenhouse Gas Emissions, which Electrical & Electronic Equipment does not.
